comments:
Get null pointer exception when attempting to view CVS info in project?s 
properties in the 20020321 stable build.  The failing scenario involves 1.)
disconnecting a plug-in project from CVS.  2.)Export a plug-in project.  3.)
Import a plug-in project.  The plug-in project import is suspect because we 
notice that the import creates a CVS nature in the .project file.  

So here are more details on the failing scenario: 
1.) Disconnect a plug-in project from CVS in peperation to export.
2.) Export the project to a zip file.  Look at the the .project and verifiy 
that there is no CVS nature in the project.  
	<natures>
		<nature>org.eclipse.jdt.core.javanature</nature>
		<nature>org.eclipse.pde.PluginNature</nature>
	</natures>

3.) Unzip the plug-in project on the file system
4.) You will need to delete the exported plugin from your workspace, if you are 
on the same machine or one that has the project already.
5.)Go to the File>Import Import plug-ins from the file system and Browse? to 
the plug-in you exported in the previous step. Select the plug-in to import 
from the following menu and press Finish.
6.) Open the .project file for the project and notice the CVS project nature, 
	<natures>
		<nature>org.eclipse.jdt.core.javanature</nature>
		<nature>org.eclipse.pde.PluginNature</nature>
		<nature>org.eclipse.team.cvs.core.cvsnature</nature>
	</natures>
7.) Right click on the plug-in project properties and select properties.  On 
the project properties, select CVS.  You will see a error dialog with the 
following details:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteLocation
(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSPropertiesPage.initializeValues
(CVSPropertiesPage.java:214)

	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:525)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:196)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:555)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:396)
Does the project have a .vcm_meta file in it?

On further investigation, disconnecting from CVS does not remove all vestiges 
of CVS.  Disconnect leaves .vcm_meta and .cvsignore in the project.  When the 
CVS filse are removed from the export, and the plug-in project import does not 
create the project with a CVS nature.

This re-appearance of the CVS nature was caused by the existance of 
the .vcm_meta file and has been fixed in later builds (i.e. the .vcm_meta file 
is only read if there is a CVS folder). 

For .project files in imported projects, we should remove the nature if there 
is no CVS folders.

Action:

    For .project files in imported projects, we should remove the nature if 
    there is no CVS folders.
